newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - FRANCE - LE MONDE MAY 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - FRANCE - LE MONDE MAY 23.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Left-wing and right-wing political parties call on voters to cast "useful" votes rather than disperse votes towards minor political formations.

-- Senior Japanese Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara says in an interview he does not see Bank of Japan hiking rates before an expected economic upturn proves real, but expects a 0.5 percent hike in rates in the coming year, adds the future euro single currency is to become a pillar of the world monetary system.
-- Paribas sells Belgian banking subsidary network to Arco-Bacob group.
-- Axa-UAP is expected to sell Belgium-based insurer Royale Belge.
-- Eurotunnel authorized to resume Shuttle freight service halted after a fire broke out in the tunnel last year.
-- Renault carmaker to supply engines to Korea's Daewoo.
